channel.title: So I was just playing Civ5 against ai
channel.description:
...and America allied with me for the whole game, helped me in wars with other states, gave me arms... and then turned around for no reason and declared me "bloodthirsty" and wiped me out.
Anyone else impressed with the realism in Civ5? :)

item.title: So I was just playing Civ5 against ai
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

0o. Played it a second time around and i sorta liked it. How its turn based is a real boner kill.

Read full topic

item.title: So I was just playing Civ5 against ai
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:35, topic:366493”]I’ve actually never played any of the Civilization games, but loved this game called ‘Alpha Centauri’, which I’ve rather recently found is apparently something of a sequel to one of the Civ games. If they are anything like it I’ll probably try it out. I’ll miss the fungal blooms though, I doubt we have those on earth… :([/quote]Alpha Centauri was pretty much a spiritual successor to Civ, and equally much fun!

Read full topic

item.title: So I was just playing Civ5 against ai
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“Radeon, post:27, topic:366493”][quote author=Thug-life link=topic=462690.msg3386641#msg3386641 date=1288513640]
Hardly.

He was just asking what a Turn-Based Strategy game has to do with a Real-time Strategy game?
[/quote]
Well thanks for clarifying that, I didn’t know what he was asking.

As for the question, Turn-based strategy games are related to Real-time strategy games in the sense that they are both strategy game genres.[/quote]

I’m so sorry but I had to giggle. That’s like saying a first person shooter is related to an RTS because they’re both games.

Read full topic

item.title: So I was just playing Civ5 against ai
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:18, topic:366493”][quote author=Frell link=topic=462690.msg3385961#msg3385961 date=1288461885]
Could someone post some screenshots? I really hope this isnt the same cartoony shit as the 4th(?) one. Im hoping its a mix of AOE and Civ
[/quote]

No it’s still classic civ. AoE and Civ are really quite different games.

I’ve gone off the civ games though since #4. I got hooked playing CivNet like 14 years ago, but the turn based style has finally got old for me.[/quote]Civ V really renews the series thanks to the hexagons and a combat system that is actually FUN! (Especially in Multiplayer)

Read full topic

item.title: So I was just playing Civ5 against ai
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

thepinksock:

Ontopic: I searched briefly on tpb for civ5 but couldn’t find it, is it actually available on torrent websites?

http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/5850233/Sid.Meiers.Civilization.V-SKIDROW-[tracker.BTARENA.org].iso
and
http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/5857499/Sid-Meiers-Civilization-V-Update-1-SKIDROW
Apparently some people have had problems with the update not working, though. I haven’t had any problems with the main release.

Read full topic
